alert.note: Alert for Wallowa (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 6:38PM PDT until August 22 at 7:30PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pendleton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Double Creek Burn Scar in... East Central Wallowa County in northeastern Oregon... * Until 730 PM PDT. * At 638 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Double Creek Burn Scar. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1.5 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Double Creek Burn Scar. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Double Creek Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Double Creek Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of East Central Wallowa County FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
